metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29957 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
If a MIME encoded email contains an OpenPGP inline signed or encrypted message part, but also contains an additional unprotected part, Thunderbird did not indicate that only parts of the message are protected. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29957` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.2').
